article.headline: Montana 76, Idaho State 57
article.story:
MISSOULA (AP) -- Hollie Tyler had 13 points and six rebounds
Saturday as Montana remained unbeaten in the Big Sky Conference
with a 76-57 victory over second-place Idaho State.

Crystal Baird scored eight of her 12 points during a 12-0 run
that put Montana (20-4, 9-0 Big Sky) up 20-9 with 9:09 left in the
first half.

Idaho State (15-6, 7-2) answered with a 7-2 run to pull within
22-16 on a layup by Heidi Gifford with 7:46 left in the half.

Montana -- which outshot ISU 56 percent to 30 percent in the
first half -- built as much as a 39-19 lead on a 3-pointer by Julie
Deming at the 2:12 mark before taking a 43-26 halftime lead.

Montana led by as many as 22 points in the second half and Weber
State could get no closer than 70-55 on two free throws by Merrilee
Udy with 3:07 remaining.

Juliann Keller and Katie Edwards also scored 12 points for the
Lady Griz, followed by Deming with 11. Brooklynn Lorenzen had 11
assists as Montana won its 17th straight home game and its 10th
straight overall.

Annie Anderson led Idaho State with 21 points and 12 rebounds,
while Gifford had 11 rebounds.
